description.narrative: Sweden's development cooperation in Ukraine includes areas of democratic governance and society development. The contribution is aimed to provide institutional support (during 2013-2016) to the NGO Environment-People-Law to improve its internal capacities to duly implement its mission and vision to protect environment in Ukraine.

The CSO Environment-People-Law (EPL) is striving to achieve better quality of governance of its civil society organisation and serve communities better. EPL has passed a period of about a year during 2013-2014 improving its strategy, planning, reporting and internal controls, pursuat to the recommendations expressed by the Sida professional advisors in this area (SDA). The follow-up review for the conformity (performed by SDA in May 2014) further identified finalization matters and recommended Sida to pursue with the core support programme for EPL.
The development intervention objective is to facilitate development of better environmetal awareness and protection through active civil society organisations.

Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: The first phase of core support of the NGO Environment-People-Law has concluded in 2017 with most of the objectives set forth in the Strategic Plan of the organisation achieved or well on track towards achievement. Internal transformations and growth of the organisation (Component 1 – Management) have resulted in: - Developed and implemented guidelines and manuals for personnel of the organisation and for the participants of the volunteer network. Regular “maintenance” and updates of these documents; - Regular participatory development of annual plans and work programmes (2014-2018 and beyond) that connect different areas of EPL’s activities;Developed fundraising strategy and plan for improving financial sustainability of the organisation (2017-2020); - Creation and development of the EPL volunteer network from scratch to over 60 active members (2017); - Strengthened capacity of EPL in policy analysis (research, editorial, monitoring and evaluation policies and instruments developed, trainings in policy analysis conducted); - Improved capacity in anticorruption analysis, research and reporting;Developed advocacy and communication potential of the organization (communication strategy developed and implemented; regular communication plans are developed and implemented; staff of the EPL receives regular training in analytical writing) Key area where organization applied these improved and developed skills and potential - Component 2 - Environmental justice and order for sustainable development - produced following results: - Policy papers and analysis developed on legal responsibility for environmental violations, environmental control and supervision system, forest management, waste management, methodologies for local waste management programs development, creation of new protected areas etc; - Participation in the strategy and law drafting processes on the national level: adoption of the National Waste Strategy (2017) with partial acceptance of EPL’s proposals, proposals submitted to 11 draft laws on environmental protection and 6 draft laws on waste management, adoption of the laws on Environmental Impact Assessment (2017) and Strategic Environmental Assessment (2018) with input and advocacy from EPL; - Development and maintenance of the electronic system of environmental information for pilot regions including Lviv, Zakarpattia, Ivano-Frankivsk and Kirovohrad regions;Provision of pro bono legal consultations and support to citizens, communities and organizations – over 200 cases per year, with typical cases being posted on the website, legal guidelines developed and shared through the website; - Development and implementation of the Joint training for judges with the National School of Judges using the course “Environmental protection and human rights”- over 30 judges trained each year;Handling court cases for protection of environmental rights in strategic cases - 9 positive court decisions in 2017. EPL has also worked on raising awareness about environmental issues in Ukraine - Component 3. A clearer and louder voice. The following results were achieved: Information and media campaigns on environmental issues have contributed to the slight improvement of the awareness among the general public in environmental topics; Participation in working groups/committees within regional and national authorities, active engagement in the work of the largest CSO coalition – Reanimation Package of Reforms has helped to maintain focus on environmental issues as part of the overall reform agenda; Participation and organisation of conferences, seminars, workshops, round-tables, trainings has resulted in EPL being recognized as one of the leading environmental CSOs in the country.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
